title: List of countries with KFC franchises
data: First outlet in Albania opened in Tirana on April 14 , 2016 at the Tirana East Gate Mall . The second one opened on October 7 , 2016 at the Ish-Blloku . KFC is the first international fast food chain in Albania
First entered the country in 1970 but withdrew . Returned in 2005 with a store in Vienna . 6 outlets as of 2018 , with plans to expand to up to 50 the coming years

In October 2012 , the world 's largest KFC opened in Baku . The 1,600-square-meter outlet , with a seating capacity of 300 , is housed in the city 's Sabunçu rail station built in 1926 . AFK Ltd reportedly invested 3 million euros to restore the nearly destroyed building . 8 outlets
Bel Food Service LLC , CreativeFood-S-Vostok LLC
The first Belgian KFC restaurant opened in Brussels North Railway Station in June 2019
First store opened in Sofia . The first international fast food brand in Bulgaria . 22 outlets
First store opened in Zagreb . 6 outlets in Zagreb and 1 in Split
First outlet in Prague . 88 outlets in July 2018
Opened in the 1970s , but later closed . Returned in 1991 , with 10 outlets as of 2019
KFC opened first restaurant in Estonia on the 24th of October 2019 in Ülemiste centre . 2 outlets as of November 2019
Opened in 1991 , but all seven stores were closed by 1992 . Returned in 2001 , with 211 outlets in September 2017
First restaurant was opened at Hansaallee in Frankfurt in 1968 . Struggled to reach 12 stores by 1995 . 163 outlets by March 2018 , with plans to expand to up to 500 in the next five to seven years
First outlet in Piraeus near Athens . 8 outlets
The store on Király Street in Budapest was the first Central European KFC in a post-communist country . The previous master franchise holder was Hemingway Holding AG . 70 outlets by 2020
First opened in Phibsborough shopping centre . Major franchisees include MBCC Foods and Herbel Restaurants ( Ireland ) Ltd 40 outlets in June 2017
Very first outlet opened in Naples in the 1970s , but since closed . Returned on November 21 , 2014 with the first restaurant in Rome . 40 outlets in December 2019 . See KFC Italia
section_text: A KFC in Munich , Germany . By the time it was opened it was claimed to be the biggest KFC in the world . A KFC restaurant at Chelyuskintsev Street in Novosibirsk , Russia A KFC restaurant at Canterbury , England , United Kingdom A KFC in Groningen , Netherlands
intro:
This is a list of countries with KFC franchises. As of year end 2018, there are KFC outlets in 142 countries and territories in the world. The first KFC franchise opened in the United States in 1952, and in Canada a year later. [citation needed] The first overseas franchise was established in the United Kingdom in 1965. [citation needed] A large number of Caribbean and developed Western markets entered by the early 1970s. This was followed by expansion throughout the Middle East and developed Asian markets from the mid-1970s and into the 1980s. China was entered in 1987. Expansions were made into most of Europe and South America in the early 1990s. The most recent area of expansion is Africa, where the company is targeting the continent's growing middle class. The major markets for KFC include China (4,563 units), the United States (4,020 units), Japan (1,181 units), the United Kingdom (900 units), South Africa (736 units), Malaysia (701 units), Canada (663 units), Australia (618 units), Russia (608 units), and Thailand (531 units). [citation needed]
 The global operations are overseen by Yum International, which is headquartered in Louisville, Kentucky. Yum!
